content.en: Adaptive Optics: Researchers are exploring the use of algorithms to improve the quality and performance of free-space optical communication systems. These algorithms, such as the Stochastic Parallel Gradient Descent (SPGD) algorithm and the Zernike polynomials-based SPGD algorithm, aim to mitigate wave-front distortions and improve the quality of distorted orbital angular momentum beams. Other algorithms, like the Direct-gradient (DG) method and the Modified Gerchberg-Saxton (GS)-based phase retrieval algorithm, are being developed to compensate for distorted beams and correct wavefront distortions. These advancements in adaptive optics have the potential to enhance the efficiency and reliability of optical communication in free space.
content.da: Adaptiv Optik: Forskere undersøger brugen af algoritmer til at forbedre kvaliteten og ydeevnen af fri-rum optiske kommunikationssystemer. Disse algoritmer, såsom Stochastic Parallel Gradient Descent (SPGD) algoritmen og Zernike polynomier-baserede SPGD algoritmen, sigter mod at afbøde bølgefrontforvrængninger og forbedre kvaliteten af forvrængede orbitale vinkelmomentumstråler. Andre algoritmer, som Direct-gradient (DG) metoden og den modificerede Gerchberg-Saxton (GS)-baserede fase-gendannelsesalgoritme, er under udvikling for at kompensere for forvrængede stråler og korrigere bølgefrontforvrængninger. Disse fremskridt inden for adaptiv optik har potentiale til at forbedre effektiviteten og pålideligheden af optisk kommunikation i fri-rum.
